stimulusHtml: The statue of the seated scribe indicates that sculptors in Old Kingdom Egypt were willing to deviate from the traditional canon of representation, as exemplified by the statue of King Menkaura and queen, when they were
choicesHtml: memorializing loved ones, so as to emphasize unique attributes
depicting an important character found in the Book of the Dead
chronicling the ravages of age and ill health
portraying figures of relatively lesser social status
